intro: Cremaspora congesta, commonly known as the clustered flame tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, with dense clusters of leaves and flowers. Its foliage is glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant floral display. Cremaspora congesta is well adapted to coastal and sandy soils, making it a resilient and ornamental plant in its native habitat.
